basics.name: Jordan Patrick Martin
basics.label: Full Stack Engineer
basics.summary: Organized and motivated full stack engineer seeking to work collaboratively with a team of experienced engineers to craft a product that benefits my community and society, at large.

work.summary: Working with Git, GitHub, JavaScript, Java, SQL, and Rest to develop and maintain financial web applications.
highlights: Maintained over twenty java and VB6 applications for John Deere’s revolving credit business
Implemented DevOps solutions for continuous improvement using Jenkins, XLDeploy and Artifactory
Practiced leadership by coaching my team’s intern in development of his project and final presentation

work.summary: Implemented security by design (SbD) principles for a corporate firewall team.
highlights: Evaluated multiple solutions for secure configuration for the firewall team
Developed a proof of concept solution using Ansible
Led without authority by serving as scrummaster of an Agile Scrum team

work.summary: Developed a solution for third-party developers to create layers for the agricultural maps for growers to see in the mobile application MyAnalyzer™.
highlights: Collaborated on a full-stack Agile Scrum team to develop new features and maintain two agronomic mobile apps for both Android and iOS
Learned to practice paired programming and test-driven development
Created a feature to allow outside companies to contribute map layers to the MyAnalyzer™ iOS app and began work on the Android app

work.summary: Developed a tool for business decision makers to import testing data from three testing frameworks to make decisions about large tractors.
highlights: Planned, organized and wrote code in Visual Basic for Applications to automate repetitive data processing and analysis in Microsoft Excel
Standardized the output of multiple types of tests across a range of tractor models
Organized and executed a curriculum revolving around STEM in the Waterloo community
